title: Boxing Day Test
articleDescription: Extra services will be running on Friday 26, Saturday 27 and Sunday 28 December 2025 at the MCG
articleContent:
Gates Open: 9:00 am
Play commences: 10:30 am
Play concludes: 5:00 pm – 6:00 pm (depending on light/weather)

Cranbourne and Pakenham line passengers continue to have direct services to and from Richmond Station during December 2025 and January 2026. Ordinary timetables, including extra event trains, run as usual; for Sunbury line passengers, these are to and from Flinders Street.

Passengers on the Cranbourne, Pakenham or Sunbury lines wishing to experience the Metro Tunnel to get to the MCG can use Town Hall Station and:

  • Catch the Route 48 tram on Collins Street to the MCG
  • Walk 5 minutes to Flinders Street and catch the Route 70 or Route 75 trams to the MCG
  • Use the Degraves Street Subway to transfer to Flinders Street for trains to Jolimont or Richmond
  • Walk 25 minutes via William Barak Bridge to the MCG  

With the Metro Tunnel open for the Summer Start, operational hours are 10am – 7pm on public holidays and weekends, and 10am – 3pm on weekdays until The Big Switch on 1 February.  

Before you travel

If you use Journey Planner, you'll see all the extra services we've added to help you get there.

Friday 26 December – Day 1

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the match:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Frankston, Sandringham, Werribee, Sunbury, Watergardens and Craigieburn passengers.

Additional services for the following lines depart after the match:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Flinders Street, Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Cheltenham, Sandringham, Watergardens and Craigieburn passengers.

Sunbury/Watergardens/Craigieburn specials depart from Flinders Street 30–35 mins after the event.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the MCG

Extra trams will operate as shuttles along:

  • Route 48a between Wellington Parade/Simpson Street Stop 13 and Collins Street/Victoria Harbour Stop D18
  • Route 70a between Flinders Street West Stop 06, and MCG/John Cain Arena stop 7C.
  • Route 75a between Flinders Street Stop 04 and Wellington Parade/Simpson Street Stop 13.

Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246 (Elsternwick to Clifton Hill via St Kilda)

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

Additional services for the following lines arrive at Southern Cross before the match:

South Geelong, Wyndham Vale, Ballarat and Kyneton

Additional services for the following lines depart Southern Cross after the match:

South Geelong, Wyndham Vale, Ballarat, Kyneton

Return coaches for the following lines depart after the match:

Seymour Line
